com.samskivert.util
Class FailureListener<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.util.FailureListener<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResultListener<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplainingListener
public abstract class FailureListener<T>
extends Object
implements ResultListener<T>

The pessimist's dream. This ResultListener silently eats requestCompleted but makes subclasses handle requestFailed.

Method Detail

requestCompleted

public final void requestCompleted(T result)
Description copied from interface: ResultListener
Called to communicate that the request succeeded and that the result is available.

Specified by:
requestCompleted in interface ResultListener<T>

retype

public <V> FailureListener<V> retype(Class<V> klass)
Recasts us to look like we're of a different type. We can safely do this because we know that requestCompleted never actually looks at the value passed in.
